title: Does anyone else despise Wukong
body: Just... why is he in the game? No I'm sorry if you take this as a QQ post, but I need to let off some steam somehow! Every time I see this guy on the other I die i bit inside because I know I have to face with his bullshit and possibly get stomped. Really the thing that makes me so pissed off about him is that he's clarified as a fighter tank. Tank. **TAAAANNNKK**! How the fuck is this champion, pretty much going full AD half the time I play against him and just deleting people and entire teams, a secondary tank?!?! Seriously this guy is not a tank, he's a god damn assassin. What other fighter tanks do you know of that have invisibility/stealth or whatever the fuck it is nowadays? I know there are other champions that I should hate like {{champion:157}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:67}}  (I do hate these champions) but Wukong is just one of those champions that just consistently gets under my skin but seems like he doesn't for anyone else.

Unnecessary story: My favorite melee Champs (I usually prefer ranged both gameplay and fantasy wise) were Trundle and GP. They were both reworked and I no longer liked GP at all, and I Liked Trundle less than before. Then they were both nerfed over and over.

Then my favorite melee Champs were Shaco  and Fizz. They were both reworked and I no longer liked Fizz at all, and Shaco a lot less. And shaco is being nerfed over and over.

Then my favorite melee champions were WW and Wukong. WW was reworked and I like him a lot less, but at least more than GP and Fizz. They already confirmed Wukong to be a diver receiving significant changes in the diver update.

Soon you will not have to worry about Wukong (unless his rework Rengars him or something) and I will be left enjoying no melee Champs besides rammus and malphite, and even they are not amazingly appealing to me.
I mean, tbh that sounds like you just like shitty and poorly designed champions.

He's classified as a secondary tank because of his passive. You can actually become quite tanky if you build the right items on him.

Building 0 armor when he's super far ahead and going full lethality seems like your main problem though, not so much the champion :>)

....ok, I'll admit the no armor lethality is usually what i hate about this champ. However,  Wukong himself is just annoying and still very misleading to me because he's still classified as a tank. 

Tanks to my definition are champions that have a fair amount of CC, large health and toughness. Wukong on the other hand, outside of the first knockup on his ult, has almost no other CC and can just benefit from defense stats just by getting into team fights while not really building any armor or health items. 

As well, how many fighter tanks do you know that have an stealth decoy bullshit or a gap closer? These aspects of him constantly lead me believing that he's more of a fighter assassin than a fighter tank, which Riot's continue to classify him as and it just continues to piss me off.

> [{quoted}](name=Forhonor321,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8BvEwwHG,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2017-02-07T18:50:27.553+0000)

> Tanks to my definition are champions that have a fair amount of CC, large health and toughness. Wukong on the other hand, outside of the first knockup on his ult, has almost no other CC and can just benefit from defense stats just by getting into team fights while not really building any armor or health items. 

Tank secondaries do not have to fall exactly within that line, they can be extremely squishy and not provide CC if they don't build tank items and that's perfectly fine. Examples of that are Aatrox, Camille, Shyvana just to name a few.

That being said -- why does it matter what champions are classified as? So what if wukong is more of an assassin now thanks to the lethality items?
